alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cape May; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 22 at 3:52PM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Tidal areas in the New Jersey counties of Cape May, Atlantic, southeastern Burlington and Ocean. * WHEN...From noon until 8:00 PM Saturday. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs in coastal and bayside communities and along inland tidal waterways. Many roads become impassable. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With the long duration of onshore winds expected, the back bays may struggle to drain during low tides. This could result in minor to moderate coastal flooding lingering after high tide. Additionally, minor flooding is possible again with the Sunday afternoon high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Atlantic Ocean at Atlantic City MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 7.0 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 23/02 AM 4.8 0.2 1.5 None 23/02 PM 7.0 2.4 2.5 Moderate 24/03 AM 5.3 0.7 2.0 None 24/04 PM 6.1 1.5 1.4 Minor 25/04 AM 4.6 0.0 1.0 None Great Egg Harbor Bay at Ocean City MLLW Categories - Minor 5.3 ft, Moderate 6.3 ft, Major 7.3 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 23/02 AM 4.5 0.5 1.3 None 23/03 PM 6.3 2.3 2.0 Moderate 24/03 AM 4.8 0.8 1.6 None 24/04 PM 5.5 1.5 1.0 Minor 25/05 AM 4.1 0.1 0.6 None Cape May Harbor at Cape May MLLW Categories - Minor 6.2 ft, Moderate 7.2 ft, Major 8.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.1 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 3.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 23/02 AM 5.4 0.3 1.8 None 23/03 PM 7.3 2.2 2.3 Moderate 24/03 AM 5.4 0.3 1.8 None 24/04 PM 6.4 1.3 1.2 Minor 25/05 AM 4.8 -0.3 0.8 None Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 23/01 AM 2.7 0.2 0.8 None 23/03 PM 4.5 2.0 1.8 Moderate 24/02 AM 3.4 0.9 1.5 None 24/04 PM 4.0 1.5 1.2 Minor 25/04 AM 3.1 0.6 0.9 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
